abstract: Hungarian Prime Min Viktor Orban, condemned for noxious rants against thousands of migrants overflowing continent, now gets nods of silent approval from European Union officials; discovery that some of terrorists responsible for deadly Paris attacks in November entered France disguised as refugees raises alarm among EU officials, and puts Orban’s invective and call to close borders in new light.
lead_paragraph: While repelled by the hate-mongering that has accompanied Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s positions, European leaders have begun to echo him on many points.

headline.main: Hungary’s Migrant Stance, Once Denounced, Gains Some Acceptance
headline.print_headline: Hungary’s Angry Stance on Migrants, Once Vilified, Gains Some Acceptance

snippet: While repelled by the hate-mongering that has accompanied Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s positions, European leaders have begun to echo him on many points.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
